exceptions.tactic: pose proof (fun p => constructive_choice _ _ (H p)) as Hp.
exceptions.exn: In environment X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop H : forall p : pos n, exists x : X, R p x p : pos n The term "H p" has type "exists x : X, R p x" while it is expected to have type "forall x : ?X, {x0 : ?T x | ?R x x0}".

exceptions.tactic: pose proof (fun p => proj1_sig (Hp p)) as f.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
n: nat
R: pos n -> X -> Prop

Goal:
(forall p : pos n, exists x : X, R p x) -> exists f : pos n -> X, forall p : pos n, R p (f p)

Premises:
Notation pos := Fin.t
pos_reif_t : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (R : pos n -> X -> Prop), (forall p : pos n, {x : X | R p x}) -> {f : pos n -> X | forall p : pos n, R p (f p)}
vec_reif_t : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (R : pos n -> X -> Prop), (forall p : pos n, {x : X | R p x}) -> {v : vec X n | forall p : pos n, R p (vec_pos v p)}
constructive_choice : forall (X : Type) (T : X -> Type) (R : forall x : X, T x -> Prop), (forall x : X, {x0 : T x | R x x0}) -> {f : forall x : X, T x | forall x : X, R x (f x)}
map_vec_pos_equiv : forall (X : Type) (R : X -> X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (T : Y -> Y -> Prop), (forall y : Y, T y y) -> (forall x y z : Y, T x y -> T y z -> T x z) -> forall (n : nat) (f : vec X n -> Y), (forall (p : pos n) (v : vec X n) (x y : X), R x y -> T (f (vec_change v p x)) (f (vec_change v p y))) -> forall v w : vec X n, (forall p : pos n, R (vec_pos v p) (vec_pos w p)) -> T (f v) (f w)
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
in_vec_inv : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (v : vec X n) (x : X), in_vec x v -> exists p : pos n, vec_pos v p = x
vec_list_inv : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (v : vec X n) (x : X), In x (vec_list v) -> exists p : pos n, x = vec_pos v p
in_vec_dec_inv : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (v : vec X n), (forall x y : X, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall x : X, in_vec x v -> {p : pos n | vec_pos v p = x}
vec_nat_induction : forall (n : nat) (P : vec nat n -> Type), P vec_zero -> (forall p : pos n, P (vec_one p)) -> (forall v w : vec nat n, P v -> P w -> P (vec_plus v w)) -> forall v : vec nat n, P v
pos_left_right_rect : forall (n m : nat) (P : pos (n + m) -> Type), (forall p : pos n, P (pos_left m p)) -> (forall p : pos m, P (pos_right n p)) -> forall p : pos (n + m), P p
pos_S_invert : forall (n : nat) (P : pos (S n) -> Type), P pos0 -> (forall p : pos n, P (pos_nxt p)) -> forall p : pos (S n), P p
Fin.of_nat_to_nat_inv : forall p : pos ?m, Fin.of_nat_lt (proj2_sig (Fin.to_nat p)) = p where ?m : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (pos ?m -> pos ?n) -> pos (p + ?m) -> pos (p + ?n) where ?m : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat] ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
Fin.to_nat_inj : forall p q : pos ?n, proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p) = proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat q) -> p = q where ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
FinFun.bSurjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall y : nat, y < n -> exists x : nat, x < n /\ f x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bSurjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
Fin.caseS' : forall (p : pos (S ?n)) (P : pos (S ?n) -> Type), P pos0 -> (forall p0 : pos ?n, P (pos_nxt p0)) -> P p where ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
vec_pos_ext : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (v w : vec X n), (forall p : pos n, vec_pos v p = vec_pos w p) -> v = w
Fin.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, pos (S n) -> Type, (forall n : nat, P n pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (p : pos (S n)), P n p -> P (S n) (pos_nxt p)) -> forall (n : nat) (p : pos (S n)), P n p
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : pos ?n, pos_nxt x = pos_nxt y -> x = y where ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
Fin.of_nat_ext : forall h h' : ?p < ?n, Fin.of_nat_lt h = Fin.of_nat_lt h' where ?p : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat] ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
VectorDef.caseS' : forall (v : vec ?A (S ?n)) (P : vec ?A (S ?n) -> Type), (forall (h : ?A) (t : vec ?A ?n), P (h ## t)) -> P v where ?A : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- Type] ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
vec_map_set_pos : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (n : nat) (s : pos n -> X), vec_map f (vec_set_pos s) = vec_set_pos (fun p : pos n => f (s p))
VectorSpec.eta : forall v : vec ?A (S ?n), v = VectorDef.hd v ## VectorDef.tl v where ?A : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- Type] ?n : [X : Type n : nat R : pos n -> X -> Prop |- nat]
map_vec_map_list : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (n : nat) (v : vec nat n) (g : pos n -> X), map f (vec_map_list v g) = vec_map_list v (fun p : pos n => f (g p))

```coq
intros H.
pose proof (fun p => constructive_choice _ _ (H p)) as Hp.
pose proof (fun p => proj1_sig (Hp p)) as f.
exists f.
intros p.
apply (proj2_sig (Hp p)).
Qed.
```

original: intros H. pose proof (fun p => constructive_choice _ _ (H p)) as Hp. pose proof (fun p => proj1_sig (Hp p)) as f. exists f. intros p. apply (proj2_sig (Hp p)).
